level.heading: Temporary Legislation
level.text: For temporary (225 days) addition of D.C. Law 18-335, § 7a, see § 2(g) of the Prohibition on Government Employee Engagement in Political Activity Temporary Amendment Act of 2013 (D.C. Law 20-4, May 18, 2013, 60 DCR 4624, 20 DCSTAT 1268).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 days) addition of D.C. Law 18-335, § 7a, amending subdivision (7) of this section, see § 2(g) of the Prohibition on Government Employee Engagement in Political Activity Emergency Amendment Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-25, March 7, 2013, 60 DCR 3986, 20 DCSTAT 485).

For temporary (90 days) addition of D.C. Law 18-335, § 7a, amending subdivision (7) of this section, see § 2(g) of the Prohibition on Government Employee Engagement in Political Activity Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-231, December 20, 2013, 61 DCR 3, 20 DCSTAT 2633).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 20-80
level.text: Law 20-80, the "Prohibition on Government Employee Engagement in Political Activity Amendment Act of 2013," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-80. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 5, 2013, and December 3, 2013, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 27, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 20-250 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-80 became effective on February 22, 2014.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: D.C. Law 18-335, § 7a, as added by D.C. Law 20-80, § 2(g), is codified as § 1-1161.01(7)(E-i).
